title: Introduction to SQL
description: Learn the basics of SQL and how it forms the foundation of working with databases.
queryExplanation: This query selects all columns from the 'users' table.
executionSteps: Open your SQL editor or DBMS
Type the query: SELECT * FROM users;
View all rows and columns in the result
dos: Always specify the table name in SELECT statements
Test queries on sample data first
donts: Don’t use SELECT * in production if not needed
Avoid querying large tables without LIMIT or WHERE clause
Don’t forget semicolons in multi-statement queries
proTips: Use SELECT column_name instead of * for better performance and clarity.

title: Using WHERE Clause
description: Filter records using the WHERE clause in SQL.
queryExplanation: Returns only the users whose age is greater than 25.
executionSteps: Understand the structure of your table
Add a WHERE clause to filter based on condition
dos: Combine with AND/OR for multiple conditions
donts: Don’t forget to test boundary conditions (e.g., =, <, >)
Don’t use WHERE with incorrect column names
proTips: Use indexes on columns used in WHERE for faster results.
